course_title: Special Topics in History: After Empire
class_notes: Decolonization was a global process that defined and shaped not only imperial territories but also imperial metropoles and the international order. This course will ask how far the history of Europe was shaped and is still shaped by decolonization. From international law to tax heavens, the welfare state to neoliberal and racialized capitalism, we will consider the role of decolonization in shaping European society, economy and politics in the second half of the twentieth century.
sections: Class Nbr: 2838, Section #: 4, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 9a-12p, Instructor: T. Sasson, Status: Open
